outlook_24_72h.base_case: The conflict is on a trajectory of significant escalation. With B-2 stealth bombers potentially joining operations and Iran demonstrating continued ballistic missile volleys against Israel and US bases, the next 24-72 hours will likely see intensified strikes. Iran's leadership situation remains uncertain — if Khamenei's death is confirmed, IRGC command chaos could either paralyze or radicalize Iranian military decision-making. outlook_24_72h.de_escalation_pathways: De-escalation pathways are extremely limited at present. UN diplomatic efforts have failed, and both sides are in active retaliation cycles. The only plausible de-escalation routes would be: (1) a decisive military outcome that forces one side to the negotiating table, (2) internal Iranian leadership collapse creating a power vacuum that halts operations, or (3) massive international pressure (UN, EU, China, Russia) forcing ceasefire. Currently, no third-party mediation appears active or credible. The conflict trajectory points toward continued escalation through at least 72 hours.
